page.title: 03EDUCATION IN CLOPHILL
page.content: The system of{Education}in N & Mid. Bedfordshire is that of{Lower, Middle {& Upper Schools. Children aged 5-9 attend{St.Mary's {Lower School}in the village. This is a modern school, built in{1972}to replace one built in{1871.}There are about 90 children in the capable hands of Mrs.M.Roberts & her friendly Staff. Children aged 9-13 are taken by bus to{Robert Bloomfield Middle School}at nearby{Shefford.}Mr.Tinkler, the Head, liaises closely with the Lower School. Older children again go by bus, but this time several miles in the other direction to{Harlington Upper School. Pre-school children can attend the privately run{Playgroup}at the Village Hall. Alternatively some attend the private{Kindergarten}in Great Lane which takes pupils 3\-7. Some pupils go to private schools in Bedford.
